properties.areaDesc: Campbell, VA; Rockingham, NC; Amherst, VA; Appomattox, VA; City of Lynchburg, VA; Bedford, VA; Caswell, NC; Rockbridge, VA; Botetourt, VA; Pittsylvania, VA; Halifax, VA; City of Danville, VA
properties.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 11 at 10:33PM EST until January 11 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Blacksburg VA
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in BLACKSBURG has issued a

* Severe Thunderstorm Warning for...
Eastern Rockingham County in north central North Carolina...
Caswell County in north central North Carolina...
Western Appomattox County in central Virginia...
The City of Danville in south central Virginia...
Southwestern Rockbridge County in west central Virginia...
Campbell County in central Virginia...
Pittsylvania County in south central Virginia...
Western Halifax County in south central Virginia...
Bedford County in south central Virginia...
Southeastern Botetourt County in west central Virginia...
Amherst County in central Virginia...
The City of Lynchburg in central Virginia...

* Until 1130 PM EST.

* At 1032 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line
extending from near Buena Vista to 6 miles northwest of Greensboro,
moving northeast at 75 mph.

HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts.

SOURCE...Radar indicated. Numerous trees were reported down by
this line of storms in Giles County and in Galax.

IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees.

* Locations impacted include...
Lynchburg...
Danville...
Buena Vista...
Bedford...
Altavista...
Amherst...
and Yanceyville.

This includes The following Locations Liberty University, The
National D-Day Memorial, Danville Airport, and Lynchburg Airport.
properties.instruction:
Prepare immediately for damaging winds, as well as deadly cloud to
ground lightning. For your safety, move to an interior room on the
lowest floor of a sturdy building. Stay away from windows.

When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of hail of any
size, as well as reports of any wind damage, including downed trees
or large limbs, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free
at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be
shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and
on Twitter.
